thread.title: Three men seriously hurt after stabbings across Brampton
thread.title_full: Three men seriously hurt after stabbings across Brampton | CP24.com

author: Chris Herhalt, CP24.com
title: Three men seriously hurt after stabbings across Brampton
text:
Three men were taken to hospital with serious injuries after stabbings in two areas of Brampton early Friday morning.
Peel Regional Police tweeted they were called to a bar, All Stars Classic Bar and Grill at 14 Lisa Street, near the corner of Dixie Road and Queen Street, sometime before 2:45 a.m., for a report of two men stabbed.
Paramedics said two men were taken to hospital with serious injuries, but were conscious and breathing when they were transported.
A staff sergeant from 21 Division said one victim was stabbed outside of the bar, and another was stabbed closer to the corner of Queen Street and Dixie Road. Police told CP24 at the scene that they believe a fight started inside the bar and spilled outside to the sidewalk.
A witness inside the bar when one of the stabbings occurred said the suspects smashed all of the barâ€™s windows, and the bartender placed several patrons in the kitchen to ensure their safety.
Police tweeted that they were searching for two suspects, both black males. One was last seen wearing a black hoodie, while the other was last seen wearing a t-shirt.
A third man was stabbed inside a Wild Wing bar at 249 Queen Street in downtown Brampton, [paramedics said. Police are not sure what he was stabbed with, but say he is in serious but stable condition in hospital. Const. George Tudos said police are searching for two black male suspects, one with braids, the other with short hair.
Police say the two stabbing incidents are not related.
